comments:
Using any dialog that has a way to select files/folders.  If you have a connection created that you aren't logged into and try to login using the dialog it just displays "Expand failed. Try again" under the connection.  If you close the dialog and expand the connection in the Remote Systems View it will connect without needing you to enter your username/password again.

Steps to reproduce:

Click Search -> Remote from the menubar.

Create a new connection to a system that will require you to enter a username/password.
Expand that connection and enter your username/password.
Error displayed under the connection.

Error Log when trying to connect to an ftp-only.

------------------------------------------------
This was originally filed against FTP only, it might be fixed in the meantime.

Once created the host in the  "Browse for folder" dialog, it works fine if you right-click and select "connect". Then you'll be able to expand the roots and folders.
The "Browse for folder" dialog creates the FTPConnectorService but is not connecting it, it looks like it has to be a manual action or a bug in the "Browse for folder" dialog.

(In reply to comment #2)
> The "Browse for folder" dialog creates the FTPConnectorService but is not
> connecting it, it looks like it has to be a manual action or a bug in the
> "Browse for folder" dialog.

Dave do you know how this is intended to work?
From the dialog you should be able to automatically connect but apparently that's not happening.  I'm thinking the dialog should probably be replaced with the other browse dialog we have be using.
Can we standardize on one dialog and get rid of the other?

Yes, we should standardize on SystemRemoteFileDialog and SystemRemoteFolderDialog instead of SystemSelectRemoteFileOrFolder.  I've been meaning to get rid of the old one but there are still a few cases where it's being used (such as this).
I've changed this one so that the folder browse dialog is the SystemRemoteFolderDialog.  The connect works fine within it.

(In reply to comment #6)
> Yes, we should standardize on SystemRemoteFileDialog and
> SystemRemoteFolderDialog instead of SystemSelectRemoteFileOrFolder.

Ok, I have filed bug #187014 to track removal of SystemSelectRemoteFileOrFolderDialog. It's currently assigned to you with a target milestone of 2.0, meaning that for 2.0 we should take it out of the ISV docs and mark it as deprecated, pointing clients to using the newer implementations instead.
Verified new dialogs work with RC4.
